title: Geth blockchain not syncing
body:
Hi,

I've installed geth and opened the console using the command 'geth console', and as I understand it, geth should begin to sync the blockchain automatically, however it is stuck on block 0.

I'm using Windows 7 and I've made sure that my clock is synced to time.nist.gov.  I've also allowed connections to public networks on the firewall, and enabled network discovery in the network advanced sharing settings, but the console still says 'at block: 0'.

How do I get geth to sync to the ethereum blockchain so I can start mining my Windows PC?

Thanks, Phil
Are you mining on private or testnet? Are you GPU mining or CPU mining? How did you install geth?

@pgalinsky in the console, what does `eth.syncing` return? The blockchain sync needs a short time before starting up. Once it is running, the result should look like:

``` text
> eth.syncing
{
  currentBlock: 1086414,
  highestBlock: 1108691,
  knownStates: 0,
  pulledStates: 0,
  startingBlock: 1086414
}
```

Same here, cant find any peers, tried to input some manually to no avail.
Ports are unclocked.
Tested on 1.3.3, 1.3.4 and 1.3.5.

I have tried other clients, but also had problems so decided to look for causes on my PC side.

Turns out my clock was 90 seconds in the past of proper time (though still syncing with windows time service). Updating to the right time fixed it for me.

@pgalinsky Check your time with some online service. (I mean compare them manually)
Yesterday I had to set my computer time 1 minute into the future to find any peers.
@pgalinsky Could you run geth with `--verbosity=6` for a minute or two and paste the output into a github gist?

@karalabe im facing the same problem being discussed herein.Iv been trying to sync the blockchain on Geth for the past three days now and have only managed to get half way through. Though initially i enjoyed download speeds of a few second per 256 blocks, speeds have decreased to more than two min per 256 blocks.. at this rate i dont see myself completely synced before another week.. 

Iv updated my system clock, turned off firewall and/or antivirus settings etc but all in vain..

I ran verbosity=6 as you asked for and here are the results:

Could you help me troubleshoot? wasting way too much time trying to sync. 

Also  is there a list of active enodes somewhere, or the enodes of the bootstrap nodes? I would be most grateful if someone could post a list of 10-20 current stable working nodes. Would manually adding peers through admin.Peers() be suggested ?

Please help!

@karalabe
